alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, eastern Brunswick and eastern Columbus Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Batarora, or 10 miles west of Leland, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, South Masonboro Island, Snows Cut, Figure Eight Island, North Masonboro Island, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Southport, Bishop, Hightsville, Wilmington International Airport, Myrtle Grove and Murrayville. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 27 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
